description: MidAmerican Energy's Curtailment Program allows large commercial and industrial customers in Iowa and Illinois to receive financial incentives for reducing peak electrical demand. The program is designed to help maintain grid resilience and reliability during emergency conditions. Participants agree to reduce electricity use by contracted amounts during peak demand periods in exchange for capacity-based incentive payments.

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Industrial or commercial customers capable of reducing electricity use by 200 kW or more during peak demand periods are eligible.

seasonal_rates.notes: Payment rates are specified in Iowa Rider CS and Illinois Rider CS tariffs but were not publicly accessible during research
Year-round participants receive both summer and non-summer calculations

penalty_structure.penalty_description: Failure to curtail may result in reduced contracted curtailable load or disqualification from future participation. Compliance is mandatory.

payment_structure.payment_notes: Rebates paid at end of peak season based on contracted kW reduction. University of Iowa received over $1 million in a single year for participation.

call_windows.notes: MidAmerican calculates expected demand between 3 and 6 p.m. during peak periods

event_parameters.notes: Events last up to 6 hours. At least 2 hours advance notice provided. Up to 16 potential curtailment events between June 1 and September 30.

nomination_bidding.bidding_structure: Fixed capacity nomination. Customers contract for a specific kW reduction amount.

enrollment_period.notes: Complete and return Curtailment Program Contract prior to March 15. New applications processed first-come, first-served.

special_attributes: Triggered by MidAmerican transmission/distribution system conditions
Triggered by high system demand and forecasted supply deficit
Requires data communication line for interval data transmission

program_evolution.change_description: University of Iowa exceeded $1 million in incentives for first time
University of Iowa improved curtailment methods to avoid building occupant comfort impacts
Program listed as inactive or no longer accepting new applicants on Piclo platform as of September 30, 2025

program_history.notes: Program has served 125 large commercial and industrial energy users historically

technical_requirements: Provide data communication line for interval data transmission
Capable of reducing electricity by contracted amount
Maintain firm power level (minimum base level of demand)
operational_requirements: Reduce load through methods such as limiting air conditioning, reducing/shifting equipment operation, or using on-site generation
measurement_verification: MidAmerican calculates expected demand (typical demand between 3-6 PM)
Firm power level established (minimum base level of demand)
Load available for curtailment determined by difference

enrollment_options.description: Participation during summer peak period only (June 1 - September 30)
Participation during both summer and non-summer periods (June 1 - May 31)
enrollment_options.notes: Summer and non-summer periods calculated separately for year-round participants

data_sources.source_name: University of Iowa Press Release - $1M Payment
University of Iowa Press Release - Updated Operations

data_sources.notes: Payment rates not accessible during research - tariff document too large to fetch

data_sources.source_name: Illinois Electric Tariff - Rider CS (ICC No. 11)
data_sources.url: https://icc.illinois.gov/downloads/public/tariff/currentbooks/7/Electric Service Schedule Ill. C. C. No. 11[511]..pdf
data_sources.notes: Payment rates not accessible during research - tariff document too large to fetch

integration_metadata.notes: Program details well-documented but payment rates not publicly available. Program status unclear - listed as inactive on Piclo as of Sept 2025 but still advertised on MidAmerican website. Historical participation data suggests strong economic value (U of Iowa received $1M+ annually). Requires direct contact with utility for payment rate information and current enrollment status.

research_notes.data_integrity: All data extracted from verified sources. NO data was invented or estimated.
missing_data_items: Performance payment rates (program appears to be capacity-only)
Typical event frequency (only maximum of 16 events per summer specified)
Event granularity and response time details beyond 2-hour notice
Current program status (conflicting information - Piclo says inactive as of Sept 2025, but MidAmerican website still advertises program)

high_confidence: Event triggers (MISO emergency, transmission/distribution conditions, supply deficit)
medium_confidence: Call window timing (3-6 PM inferred from 'expected demand' calculation)
Payment structure (capacity-based rebates, not performance payments)

research_notes.research_methodology: Comprehensive web research including utility website, regulatory filings, third-party aggregators (Piclo), press releases, and participant case studies. Attempted to access Iowa and Illinois electric tariff documents (Rider CS) but files were too large to fetch. Payment rate information requires direct contact with utility.
recommended_next_steps: Contact MidAmerican Energy at curtailment@midamerican.com or 866-584-0871 to obtain current payment rates
Verify current program status (active vs inactive) directly with utility
Request copy of Rider CS tariff from Iowa Utilities Board and Illinois Commerce Commission for detailed payment structure
Inquire about maximum program capacity and current enrollment levels
Ask about historical event frequency and typical event characteristics
